content: The Act may be cited as the "Enhanced Emergency and Enforcement Authority Act" and includes emergency orders related to compliance during an emergency. Section 12(k) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 is amended to address the ability of investors, issuers, brokers, dealers, and other market participants to conduct securities activities efficiently and comply with securities laws. The amendment to Section 12(k) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 aims to improve the ability of market participants to comply with securities laws in a timely and efficient manner. SEC. 3. NATIONWIDE SERVICE OF PROCESS. Securities Act of 1933 and Securities Exchange Act of 1934 are amended to allow nationwide service of process for subpoenas in actions or proceedings initiated by the Commission in a US district court. Subpoenas can be served in any district without court application or cause showing, bypassing certain provisions of the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure.
